mozilla.components.support.base.log

Class Log

  • mozilla.components.support.base.log.Log

  • public class Log

    API for logging messages and exceptions.

    This class does not process any logging calls itself. Instead it forwards the calls to registered LogSink implementations.

    This class only provides a low-level logging call. The logger sub packages contains logger implementations that wrap Log and provide more convenient APIs.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Log INSTANCE
      API for logging messages and exceptions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSink(LogSink sink)
      Adds a sink that will receive log calls.
      Log.Priority getLogLevel()
      Minimum log level that log calls need to have to be forwarded to registered sinks. Log calls with a lower log level will be ignored.
      void log(Log.Priority priority, java.lang.String tag, java.lang.Throwable throwable, java.lang.String message)
      Low-level logging call.
      void reset() 
      void setLogLevel(Log.Priority p)
      Minimum log level that log calls need to have to be forwarded to registered sinks. Log calls with a lower log level will be ignored.

    • Field Detail

      • INSTANCE

        public static Log INSTANCE

        API for logging messages and exceptions.

        This class does not process any logging calls itself. Instead it forwards the calls to registered LogSink implementations.

        This class only provides a low-level logging call. The logger sub packages contains logger implementations that wrap Log and provide more convenient APIs.

    • Method Detail

      • getLogLevel

        public Log.Priority getLogLevel()

        Minimum log level that log calls need to have to be forwarded to registered sinks. Log calls with a lower log level will be ignored.

      • setLogLevel

        public void setLogLevel(Log.Priority p)

        Minimum log level that log calls need to have to be forwarded to registered sinks. Log calls with a lower log level will be ignored.

      • addSink

        public void addSink(LogSink sink)

        Adds a sink that will receive log calls.

      • log

        public void log(Log.Priority priority,
                java.lang.String tag,
                java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                java.lang.String message)

        Low-level logging call.

        Parameters:
        priority - The priority/type of this log message. By default DEBUG is used.
        tag - Used to identify the source of a log message. It usually identifies the class where the log call occurs.
        throwable - An exception to log.
        message - A message to be logged.

      • reset

        public void reset()
